document.docAuthor: Ziani, Stefano, Abdel-Dayem, Mahmoud Saleh, Aldhafer, Hathal Mohammed & Barbero, Enrico
document.docTitle: Euonthophagus carbonarius Ziani & Abdel-Dayem & Aldhafer & Barbero 2019, sensu lato
document.masterDocTitle: An overview of the Onthophagini from the Arabian Peninsula (Coleoptera: Scarabaeoidea: Scarabaeidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: An overview of the Onthophagini from the Arabian Peninsula (Coleoptera: Scarabaeoidea: Scarabaeidae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Literature quotes .
SAUDI
ARABIA
: Hejaz, “Hedjaz” (d’Orbigny 1913a). Asir Province , Aina ( Paulian 1948 ). Hejaz, Edschas ( Balthasar 1963 ). Asir Province , “Wadi Hesua nr. Wadi ad Villa”; Wadi ad Dilla. Makkah Province , Jeddah; Bahara ( Zunino 1979 ). Makka Province , Bahara ( Zunino 1981 ).
YEMEN
: Abyan Governorate , Mukeiras. Al Bayda Governorate , “El Kubar” ( Paulian 1948 ); Aden Governorate , Aden (d’Orbigny 1913a), Jemen, Aden ( Balthasar 1963 ). Sana’a governorate , San’a . Ta’izz Governorate , Jebel Harim ( Paulian 1948 ).
OMAN
: without locality ( Janikova 1998 ).

Distribution . Arabian Peninsula : Oman ( Janikova 1998 ),
Saudi Arabia
, Yemen (d’Orbigny 1913a). Africa : the species,
sensu lato
, is also widely distributed in the whole Afrotropical Region ( Balthasar 1963 ).

Remarks . According to
Barbero et al . (1998)
, different taxa are recorded under the name
E. carbonarius
. Only a taxonomic revision will resolve the status of the species presently under the name
carbonarius
.
